item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Ruby:

Wasn’t there some kid prosecuted irl because he posted evidence on mitb.com in like 07?

L2Read:

[quote=“Newty, post:10, topic:545323”]It still blows my mind that people come onto online forums and literally admit guilt. You know that we live in the digital age and if someone really wanted to pursue a case against you it wouldn’t be very hard for them to find this post.

I know it seems unlikely but we’ve actually had someone post a video of themselves vandalizing cars only to have it reported to the police and he ended up getting prosecuted and getting probation plus some fines.

tl;dr don’t ask legal advice from a rs cheating forum and don’t admit guilt ever.[/quote]

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xEthanx, post:24, topic:545323”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664204.msg4439990#msg4439990 date=1406256103]

It still blows my mind that people come onto online forums and literally admit guilt. You know that we live in the digital age and if someone really wanted to pursue a case against you it wouldn’t be very hard for them to find this post.

I know it seems unlikely but we’ve actually had someone post a video of themselves vandalizing cars only to have it reported to the police and he ended up getting prosecuted and getting probation plus some fines.

tl;dr don’t ask legal advice from a rs cheating forum and don’t admit guilt ever.

If the case already went through the court systems, at least in America, you can’t be tried for it again. So, yes, if you did something illegal and haven’t been caught for it, don’t post any information that could lead them back to you for it.
[/quote]
This actually isn’t true. Well it’s true for some cases, but for this case it wouldn’t be. Yes, he was already tried, but he wasn’t already tried for the second bag as well. If I’m understanding correctly.[/quote]
His case hasn’t even been through the system yet (I believe), because typically they set the court date a month after the charge, and by then I’m sure the bag would have been thrown away, taken by someone, grabbed by him, or something.

Read full topic

If the case already went through the court systems, at least in America, you can’t be tried for it again. So, yes, if you did something illegal and haven’t been caught for it, don’t post any information that could lead them back to you for it.[/quote]
This actually isn’t true. Well it’s true for some cases, but for this case it wouldn’t be. Yes, he was already tried, but he wasn’t already tried for the second bag as well. If I’m understanding correctly.

tl;dr don’t ask legal advice from a rs cheating forum and don’t admit guilt ever.[/quote]

I believe i’ve received the information I needed, if someone wants to delete this thread

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:10, topic:545323”]It still blows my mind that people come onto online forums and literally admit guilt. You know that we live in the digital age and if someone really wanted to pursue a case against you it wouldn’t be very hard for them to find this post.

I know it seems unlikely but we’ve actually had someone post a video of themselves vandalizing cars only to have it reported to the police and he ended up getting prosecuted and getting probation plus some fines.

tl;dr don’t ask legal advice from a rs cheating forum and don’t admit guilt ever.[/quote]
If the case already went through the court systems, at least in America, you can’t be tried for it again. So, yes, if you did something illegal and haven’t been caught for it, don’t post any information that could lead them back to you for it.

item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Vix:

Today I was issued a written warning for possession of a controlled substance on Federal Grounds (Train tracks near my house). The officer found two grams of Marijuana on me and didn’t find the bag which i had tossed out of sight. The charges where dismissed and i was free’d after the Marijuana was confiscated. If a federal ranger is to find the bag in the near future could they still attribute it to me and pursue further legal actions?

If it rains before they find it THEY Cannot cause the fingerprints would not be there anymore so you would be fine if they say they have fingerprints say nothing… they did it to me for graffiting a main tourist sign couldn’t do nothing to me its not the same thing but if it rains you’ll be fine…

Read full topic
